name: New York Hilton Midtown

reviews.text: I have no major complaints about this place but I wouldn't gush about it either. The location is good - convenient for business travelers headed to one of the many nearby offices, and also good for tourists who want a good base from which to check out midtown. The place was packed when I was there. Always lots of people in the lobby. Despite this, service stayed pretty efficient. Our room was cleaned, room service was super quick, we had no problems with check-in or check-out. The restaurant downstairs was super expensive, but at least it was fast. My biggest complaint would be that the room could be cleaned more thoroughly. There were bunches stray hairs here and there, on the desk, on the toilet - that were definitely not mine. The carpet felt like it hadn't been cleaned in a while. Other than that, free wifi would have been nice. Also, I was a bit put off by having to pay to have the hotel store my bags for a few hours after check-out. Other than that, this place is what it advertises itself as - about a 4 star.
reviews.title: It's okay - great location, so-so rooms. It's a pretty efficient machine.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton New York for 2 nights in October 2010 for a seminar that was taking place in the hotel. The location of the hotel was great... Across the street from Radio City Music Hall and within a few minutes walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. I was impressed with the lobby and the service was fine upon check-in. The room itself was nice albeit not overly large (although for New York standards it was more than adequate). The bathroom was a bit small but the walk-in shower was huge. Comfortable bed and flat-screen TV. There was a bit of noise from outside but again, given that the hotel is in New York this was not a big surprise.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The only complaint I have is that there aren't enough elevators for each section of floors and there were times (particularly in the morning) when the elevators would be so packed that people couldn't get on.
reviews.title: One hassle after another

reviews.text: The room itself was nice enough, but there were so many service problems I would be reluctant to stay there again.
reviews.title: Very happy with our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is supposed to be wireless high-speed internet in the room. On arrival I spent several hours and multiple phone calls to tech service trying to get it to work. The customer service person then said they would send up a bridge device to connect to my computer, but I had to call three times to get someone to deliver it, and then it didn't work. More calls to tech service and the customer service person to get another one. Finally I was able to connect, but the "high speed" service was agonizingly slow.
reviews.title: Nice hotel
Dated and dreary, but great location
reviews.text: Recently stayed 4 nights at the Hilton for a conference. First the positives:
- Great location, felt like all the hot spots were only very short walk away
reviews.title: Major advantages over other NYC hotels

reviews.text: - Maid service was spot on, leave your room for 30 minutes, you come back and your room is clean
reviews.title: Loved the hotel and location

reviews.text: - Staff was friendly and helpful
reviews.title: Seen better....
What I expected
reviews.text: - Great shower heads and water was always high pressure and hot.
Was surprised that a room does not have Refridge or a free wireless internet in this age :(.
reviews.title: Poor animities with good location

reviews.text: situated on a good location and have a grand look when you enter the lobby. Unfortunately, it did not satisfied me :( but still a decent hotel if you wanna be near to Time square.
reviews.title: Cannot go wrong here

reviews.text: Excellent time at this hotel, top service, centrally located 1 block from radio City and a few from Rockefeller Center.
reviews.title: Sadly not the same

reviews.text: Make sure you upgrade to executive level, many perks including Continental Breakfast and better views.
reviews.title: Average in all ways but price

reviews.text: Stayed in December to see the Christmas sights, and had four in the family, staying on the 41st floor (ex. Level) and paid just over $300.00 per night plus taxes (high in NY),, Look around, use the Hilton Honors website for best pricing..
reviews.title: Great location near Btoadway

reviews.text: Great location. Rooms standard, clean and tidy. Could maybe do with updating but for the time we spent in them it really didnt matter.
reviews.title: Excellent location, could not be better!

reviews.text: The hotel bar provided us with some lovely cocktails in the evening although the tab soon added up!!
reviews.title: AVOID THIS HOTEL-BEDBUGS AND SMELLY DAMP ROOMS- HOTEL UNHELPFUL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would stay at this hotel again without a doubt in the future.
reviews.title: Terrific location for theater/Central Park

reviews.text: AVOID-damp smelly bed bug infested overpriced rooms with poor view. Hilton deny everything!!
reviews.title: Impersonal, very crowded, but good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ended up at this hotel as a result of a time-share promotion. We did have to sit through a 90-minute presentation, but felt we got an awesome value. What we did learn that this hotel is situated very close to Broadway and the theater district, making it a perfect choice is you've got plans for late night theater--easy walk. Also only 3 blocks away from Central Park and MOMA, NBC studios, 30 Rock. Rooms were nice, clean, and although not overly large, perfect for a couple of nights. And, no bed bugs! Great breakfast closeby at Astro--two block walk. I would definitely stay again--although haven't checked out the regular rates.
reviews.title: Very nice, centrally located hotel that was clean and very comfortable.

reviews.text: My husband had to travel for a conference to this hotel so I spent a lot of time on my own sightseeing. It is close to everything and a very convenient spot for tourist activities. The room was not terribly small, but not huge. It was cozy for two people. The fixtures in the bathroom were old and the lights buzzed and flickered. The only other problem we had was the elevators. We were on the 14th floor and had to walk down the steps one day b/c the elevators were not working due to some fire emergency. Normally this would not be a problem, but when you are 6 months pregnant, it was not fun.
reviews.title: Great location for tourists!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a large and sophisticated hotel; you would think the staff might be a trifle stand-offish. NOT SO. From valet car parkers to doormen to bellmen to check-in staff everyone was helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff

reviews.text: The rooms are nice sized for NY and immaculate; beds are heavenly, there's in-room coffee and tea. There's even tv in the elevators. With its great location, it is well worth the price.
reviews.title: Very Disapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When checking in met with a rude unhelpful staff member and it didnt get much better from there,rooms not refurbished and grubby ,food downside of bed skirt after several phone calls member of staff came and cleaned it off then promised to change whole bed ,came back after a night out bed hadnt been changed but a cheese plate had been left as an apologie,we would rather had a clean bed!Message left to say a gift was waiting for us at reception after inquiering about said gift we were informed that basicailly we had to sit through a presentation on the hilton vacation homes before we could get our gift ,we declined.breakfast $35 !!!rude car park staff,rude bar staff you get the picture ,refurbished rooms not available for our stay [we asked several times] but would not recommend staying in one of the old rooms yuck!!
reviews.title: Ideal for New York city break

reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed here earlier this year and having both been to New York before I think it's safe to say we agreed this was our best hotel experience there. The hotel is situated within walking distance of Central PArk, Times Sqaure, Broadway and 5th Avenue and is therefore for tourists a pretty much ideal location. However it is also far enough away from Times Sqaure to be too loud at night.
reviews.title: Ideal placement

reviews.text: First time visiting New York. We picked the right hotel! Excellent location. A block away from 5th Ave, and a short walk away from Central Park, Times Square, Rockefellar Centre. My inlaws recommended the hotel to us and I'm glad we stayed there! The rooms are in good shape & most importantly, clean. Service was great, staff were friendly and if you're willing to spend extra, try to stay at the Executive floors. The check-in line is faster (never busy - no lineups)! You also get better views - especially if you are at the east-end corner facing Central Park! And the hotel lobby is always busy & lively! But it's what NYC is all about!
reviews.title: Great location, good service!

reviews.text: I travel to NY at least twice and year and have been faithful in staying at the Hilton for quite a few years now. The rooms are large and the bathrooms are okay. However the last few times I have noticed that the housekeeping in the bath and in the rooms is appalling. They do not clean- hair is in the shower drain, bathroom floors are not cleaned. In the rooms the debris left over by the previous occupants (in-between the beds and side tables is not vacuumed). Once when I checked in the waste basket was full of rubbish. I called customer service and informd them that I wanted all the furniture moved and the whole room vaccumed but they cleaned only partially when I checked. I have sent mails but there is no response. I have found a better hotel for my next visit and it is not the Hilton!
reviews.title: "Need better housekeeping services"

reviews.text: I re-joined the "Hilton Honors" loyalty program (after having my account dropped because apparently I did not stay at their hotels often enough, so they were DISLOYAL to me!) before my stay here with a cousin. When we arrived, approx. 1 hour before the check-in time, the room was not ready. We visited the reception desk approx 10 minutes later & it was ready, which was good for our plans. I had read the tips on tripadvisor & requested a high floor, away from the elevators. We were upgraded to a deluxe corner room on the 30th floor. We had to open the windows to air out the room from the spray used by the cleaning persons, but it did air out OK. The room was relatively large for NYC (I would think) & very clean & quiet. The beds were really comfortable. The bathroom was rather small but it had everything needed, except a working exhaust fan. (I admit that I didn't report it or complain.) My cousin had a problem with the shower curtain, getting the floor pretty wet after her shower, but I didn't have a problem with it, & the shower water was nice & hot. The reception staff were nice. We asked for a later checkout time & were given one without a problem. The hotel was in a great location. The hotel is big & the lobby is not "cozy" & there are no chairs, but the room had everything we wanted, including a coffee maker, which we did not use, & a small refrigerator stocked with items, that I would not DARE to try, due to the likely price. I was able to fit one of my own drink cans & water bottles in it.. The room was very pricey but so were the other hotels we considered. Our stay was on a Sat. night on Veteran's Day weekend, so some hotels were requiring a stay of two nights (but not Hilton). I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again depending on the price & if I had a person to share the cost with.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Of the large New York City hotels, I think the Hilton is the best - the rooms are in relatively good shape, the HVAC systems are modern and the street noise is relatively muted. Also, rooms are large by the standards of New York City.
reviews.title: Above and beyond - returned the items I forgot

reviews.text: On a visit in September, though, Hilton New York really won my excellent rating. In a rush to check out, I left some shirts in a drawer. I called the hotel the next day, and the security team Fed-Ex'd the items home to me. That made me very happy!
reviews.title: very comfortable

reviews.text: This is not my first review of this hotel. The woman at the registration desk this time was very friendly and helpful. I also go a really nice room this time. Hotel definitely has some rooms that are nicer than others. Room is clean and attractive. Looking forward to using the gym in the mornings. This is the second trip in a row that this hotel is really earning my respect back. It may actually become my hotel of choice again.
reviews.title: After what seems to have been a temporary dip in quality, the Hilton is again providing the experience I like to expect.

reviews.text: Just arrived. Our first night. Room is 74 degrees despite setting it on 68 three hours earlier. Told there us no cool air would we like a fan. No remote control in room. Called for remote. Sitting in our room with windows open only two inches waiting to watch football. Ah, Remote just delivered. Very prompt. No reservation at restaurant even though concierge said he made one. So we waited a few. Not a big problem.
reviews.title: Please, we need A/C

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got an upgrade. That was nice. Room clean and nice looking. Executive lounge was nice. Hotel seems really nice so far. (Except for A/C) Locations is great. Can't wait to check out Rockefeller Center.
reviews.title: Disappointed service

reviews.text: After a very long drive we pulled into the Hilton garage to park our car , We choose this Hotel because it has on site parking. We were told they had no room for our car. Ok, where do we go, you will have to drive around and find a place. Ok.......so I get out of the car, take out all our luggage and my husband leaves to find a parking garage in the area. No bellman anywhere to be found? I then load a cart myself with our luggage and two ladies staying at the hotel hold the door for me so I can get through them. I Drag the cart to the front desk area and finally a bellman approaches to assist me with my bags and checking in. The Hotel desk clerk would not allow us to upgrade our room because it was too early in the day, I just gave up,took the room and the great bellman who assisted me came right over and took our bags to the room so we could go enjoy the city. The room was ok, great view, but the bathtub was disgusting, all scratched and peeling,and did not drain correctly. Just wasn't a relaxing experience at all. The hotel was nice enough, great location, bed was comfortable, and we loved the late check out, but I wouldn't say the Hitlon was friendly or accommodating.
reviews.title: Great location - nice room

reviews.text: Over the past few years when visiting NYC, we've chosen trendy/boutique hotels. The NY Hilton was a nice reminder of what the larger brands offer. A very spacious (for NYC) king room, large windows and VERY clean bathroom.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay after poor start.
Good experience.
reviews.text: I was a little worried based on the mixed reviews previously posted. However, we asked for a renovated room, and found our room to be clean and comfortable. The crowds of people in the lobby gave it a casino-like atmosphere. Did not eat in the hotel as plenty of places to eat in the city.

Just got back from 5 days at the Hilton New York and can only say it was perfect! The location and price cannot be beat and our standard room on the 32nd floor was great. The room was plenty big with two comfy beds and an extra sitting chair, flat screen, big bay window with sitting sill, mini bar, and plenty of closet and floor space. The bathroom was also adequate and had clever added storage space with in-set shelves and under the sink storage. Everything was clean and well-lit. The location is right by Radio City and Rockefeller Center, one block from St. Patrick's and Fifth Avenue shopping, and very convenient to Central Park. Broadway and Times Square are also walkable, but the hotel is far enough away to avoid the noise and hustle and bustle of those areas. The hotel staff was very friendly and the lobby bars are great. We highly recommend the Hilton New York and would return in a heart beat.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect!

likes.liked: — The hotel itself and its great location

reviews.title: Needs a do-over!
reviews.text: I stayed at the New York Hilton for a conference. Check in was fine and quick; however, the desk clerk seemed to have her specific list of things to go over for guests checking in. Asking questions seemed to distract her from her main goal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was given a room on the Executive Level, Room 4121. I was pretty disappointed. I expected something better for this class of room.
reviews.title: Ok hotel but overpriced

reviews.text: Here were my concerns:
reviews.title: Very Good for Hilton

likes.liked: — location and renovated room. shower was fabulous.
likes.disliked: — glasses and coffee cups left in hallway from 1PM Friday until 11 AM Satuday

reviews.text: To start with service was abysmal, very common in the US.
reviews.title: Worst Hilton I've been in my life

reviews.text: When will waiters understand that I do not care what their name is, I am not their pal and they are here to serve me an not sell a service, the minimum I expect from a staff is to be called sir (a good waiter is someone you do not notice).
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly located, the room was quite nice, I had lounge access, which to be honest was one of the best one I was able to sample (European lounges do not seems to be so nice).
reviews.title: Another Good Stay

reviews.text: One issue is that the Lounge is big and only 2 computers to connect to internet were available.
reviews.title: nice but not worth the cost

reviews.text: Now going down to the service:
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It had been several years since I was at the New York Hilton in Midtown New York. On planning the recent trip to NYC, my wife and I decided to return to this convenient location. This is the perfect Midtown NYC location. You can walk to Central Park, Broadway, Times Square and Rockafeller Center. The hotel is surrounded by many great eating establishments. We even walked to the upper Eastside and Upperwest side to visit some great neighboorhood restaurants. The subway is very convenient and we used it to go to the 911 Memorial. Our room was a nice size, with a King Size bed and a large seating area with a comfortable couch. The Executive Lounge is adequate for a nice breakfast, midday snack or evenig wine, but I have been to better lounges in other Hilton Hotels. The staff was friendly and the hotel was very clean. This is a great Hotel, but be warned--it is NYC, it is Midtown and you will pay for the location. I do look forward to the return to the Hilton as this was a fun trip.
reviews.title: Great Location but expensive

reviews.text: This may be a great place for business travelers.
reviews.title: It was ... OK

reviews.text: Rooms pretty small for the price you pay, but then this is NY and the location is premium. The great thing about the hotel is location. Walkable to Times square and Central park. No minibar. We needed a fridge for baby milk. They give you one for $35 for the duration of your stay. Once we requested it, it was delivered to our room in less than 10 minutes. Service was good overall.
reviews.title: Typical Business Trip

reviews.text: There is a decent 24-hr deli right behind, where you can buy food or milk for kids.
reviews.title: Had a fantastic stay at the Hilton Midtown

reviews.text: My biggest complaint is about the bed. Like many reviewers said they dont have queen, but only twin. Then too the beds were not comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Location and easy access to Midtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night. Quick check in with friendly service. We got a room on the 32nd floor. It was very small with only one queen sized bed. The room was very clean and nicely decorated and well lit. I am used to small hotel rooms in NYC but have never been given just one queen bed..usually two doubles or a king. The bed was comfortable enough with plenty of pillows. The problem was the noise! Even this high up we could here the door mens' whistles, traffic, sirens etc. The windows are definitely not air tight. There is also a lot of noise coming from within the hotel such as noisy pipes, water flushing, things dropping in next room, hall noise and a weird sound that kept coming and going that sounded like a truck going through a tunnel. I got a good deal on this hotel using a third party so I really can't complain too much. But the Millennium Hilton downtown is much superior.
reviews.title: Okay but nothing to write home about

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Hilton, which was one of the host hotels for the NYC 1/2 marathon. The rate was reasonable for the very nice accommodation we had - not typical for that price in NYC. The corner room was quiet and well appointed. The 2 double beds were OK. I'm a sensitive sleeper, so I though tthe mattress could have been a bit firmer. The room was average size, very clean (except for the dirty hair dryer bag), and comfortable. Bathrrom was a little smaller than normal, but overall fine. We were pleased with this hotel and I'm very picky. It was also within easy walking distance of the theater district.
reviews.title: A surprise in New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here with 2 friends for 5 nights to celebrate a 'significant' birthday of mine! It was our first visit to New York and we had been looking forward to it but we were very disappointed with the Hilton Hotel. Checking in was fairly painless. We were given rooms on the 9th floor (HHonors Diamond floor) but our room was very tiny with one side of the bed only about 10inches away from the wall so not enough space for a bedside table and lamp. The room was rather tired and was very noisy - we could hear lorries in the side street as early as 4am - it could do with soundproofing.
reviews.title: We expected better from a Hilton Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel website boasts of Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries but we had to ask for shower gel as none had been placed in either our friends' room or ours. Also, when we made coffee in the room the coffee/creamer was not always replenished.
reviews.title: i will never stay at another Hilton Hotel again after this experience

reviews.text: Housekeeping leaves a lot to be desired - of the 5 nights we were there, our friends bed was not made on 2 occasions! People using room service had left trays out in the corridor to be collected but they stayed there for days!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We always try and stay at the Hilton Mid-town in New York City because of the views in the concierge lounge normally on the top floor. We always stay on the concierge floor. Well, they have moved the concierge lounge on the lobby level with absolutely no views of the city except traffic and truck deliveries. The lounge is not that big and you have to wait in the mornings. They are catering to the business traveler because they think this is a lot more convenient. Well they have ruined the view and there is no need to stay on the concierge floor any more, if the lounge in in the lobby area.. Not worth the price difference. I hope they reconsider and move the lounge back on the top floors where they have one of the best views in the city. If not, we will be staying else where.
reviews.title: A little disappointed in one of my favorite hotels in New York

reviews.text: This was my third stay at NY Hilton Midtown. The styling of the room has not really changed much since my fist stay in 07 but they still look stylish and welcoming. Overall The location and accommodations are great. Only drawbacks are the price and the bathroom is a little awkward/small. Guess the price can be attributed to the fact that the property is not too far off Times Square, Central Park, etc.
reviews.title: Great location but pricey

reviews.text: Great Hotel and location if you are in the City to do Broadway, Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Fifth Avenue. It's even walking distance from Central Park. It is so central and walking distance to everything without being in an overwhelmingly busy area. Rooms are good, nothing over the top, comfortable and great for a home base to use as a place to sleep, change and go do some more shopping or sightseeing.
reviews.title: Fabulous location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay in New York City at the New York Hilton. We were on a Hilton timeshare deal which was worth it. Our room was small but was really all we needed. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. We walked from Penn Station, to Times Square, to our friend's Shop Studio, to the restaurant at the Marriott which revolves and to the Russian Tea restaurant. It is a very nice hotel in a great location!
reviews.title: Great Location!
Big rooms, very busy
reviews.text: I stayed here for a conference and loved that the rooms were so spacious for a NYC hotel. The hotel was super busy and because of its location, they do charge you for everything and everything is extra expensive. But the location was good and the rooms were clean so I can't complain. I would stay here again if someone else was paying but might be too expensive if just coming for fun.

I found the service of this hotel to be quite sub-par for a Hilton. The only friendly faces I met were from maintenance; and, frankly, you don't really want your hotel stay to include meeting the maintenance staff. However, I did, and they were great. The rest of the hotel staff seemed over-worked and stressed out.
reviews.title: Agree with many of the negative comments....BUT.....

reviews.text: Other negatives of the hotel include some outdated furniture in the rooms, and, some less than stellar signs of age. For example, many of the features in my room were crusted in normal dirt (air ducts, fire alarm, etc). Nothing alarming or disgusting, but certainly a sign of a hotel focused on flipping rooms, and not care. Also, my sink spigot leaks downhill, getting anything in its path wet; and, the sliding mirror doors of the closet stuck, with one continually getting out of its track. (That's an accident waiting to happen right there.)
reviews.title: Best Location to see NY
Great location, average hotel
reviews.text: OK, so what makes me give the hotel a caveat in my title? The fact that the room was SUPER quiet. And, awfully large for a midtown hotel room at a relatively competitive price. I mean, this hotel is expensive, don't get me wrong. But, I've stayed at several other hotels within a 3-block radius and, within this price point, only one offered me a larger room. And, that's a big deal. To have a room where the entire floor plan was not consumed with the bed is a nice addition to having the stay be restful.

Finally - the elevators are a drag. Few elevator cars serving multiple chunks of floors. And, not all the signal bells work, which caused me at least once to miss an elevator that arrived to my floor, but I missed it because I was looking out the window. More annoying is the stupid in-elevator TV music. It is a nonstop ad for the hotel restaurant with annoying music. Nearly every elevator ride I took included an unprompted conversation from fellow passengers about that music. If you're not going to take the TV out, at least turn the audio off.
reviews.title: Great experience!

reviews.text: I guess since I mentioned the restaurant, I might as well advise that you not waste your time or money. Very expensive. And, the food I took from the grab-and-go area of the restaurant was literally all thrown away. It was that disgusting.
reviews.title: Not your Hilton standards
Excellent "host" hotel for NYC Marathon!
reviews.text: Last week I went to run in the New York City Marathon and spent three nights at the marathon "host" hotel, The Hilton New York. Although this was an expensive adventure it was first class all the way. From the service at the front desk, to the cleaning staff, to the beautiful accomodations and view of New York, everything was impeccable! The location of the hotel was perfect. It is a five minute walk to Time Square in one direction or a five minute walk to Central Park in the other direction. You just can't get better than that!!! I LOVE NY:)

I checked into the Hilton New York on October 29th 2011, the day New York had an unexpected snow storm. The front desk was very nice and understanding to my friends and I for arriving in around 9:00 p.m. at night due to delays from Chicago. After checking in we walked into our room and were amazed how nice it was. After unpacking we headed down to the concierge desk for some information on what clubs or bars we should hit up that night. Thankfully we had a great Concierge by the name of Winny who told us what the hot places were with only a couple blocks from the hotel. Her directions were flawless and made our long day a great night. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel, set aside from our evening on Sunday night at the hotel. My friends and I stopped by the concierge desk again and unfortunately Winny was not there, but another concierge greeted us warmly by the name of Eugenia. As we began to talk we told her where we wanted to go and she wasn’t sure of the exact location, which is fine because I myself a concierge at another hotel based out of Chicago doesn’t always know where everything is in such a big city. After Eugenia printed us off the directions she explained what train to take vaguely (later getting lost for about an hour because she wasn’t specific enough on what train to take). But what really got me upset was the fact that she mentioned an ignorant comment about people who don’t speak English. She said she cannot stand when guests don’t speak English because she can’t understand. I was confused why she would say this because as a concierge in a popular tourist city, being ignorant to others inability to speak clear English is very unprofessional, and the hospitality industry is no place for someone like that. I had a great experience overall, but just found that Eugenia’s personality for the concierge desk is unprofessional and it sets a bad name for Hilton.
reviews.title: First hotel in New York

reviews.text: I get a very good corporate rate so this Hilton is good value for me (but maybe not for you if you are paying rack or close to rack)
reviews.title: Good business hotel if you get a corporate rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms nice enough if small and poorly designed (hard to reach toilet flush in last room!) with quite good sound proofing.
reviews.title: A Manhattan Staple

reviews.text: OK coffee machine in room . Paid wired internet. Free wifi in Lobby area this trip (new and very welcome addition) otherwise a Starbucks inside the hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous!!!

reviews.text: Large hotel & quite busy with everything that comes with that. Mobbed entrance with long lines for cabs, service at the concierge desk and transportation desk. Long waits for elevators. Decor was pretty outdated with the exception of the flat screen TV. Although the rooms were reasonably large for a large city hotel (we had a double- beds were not full queens.) Internet charge was $15/day!? The cost for the drinks at the bar automatically included added service charge and gratuity (on two drinks?). Housekeeping consistently provided us with only 3 bath towels, even though there was 4 of us on the reservation and kept leaving her 4 wet ones (snagged the "extra" off the maids carts every morning). Stay here for the location and don't expect much.
reviews.title: Just average

reviews.text: This is by far the worst hilton I've ever stayed in. The hotel is tired. DIRTY carpet, so old and stained no amount of cleaning can help. Broken acoustic tiles in the ceiling. Dusty rooms that hadn't been cleaned in weeks. Towels that were supposed to be white, with BODY STAINS on them. We requested clean towels only to get MORE of the same. Complaints fall on deaf ears. The staff are not attentive at best and seem indifferent and/or incompetent. DO NOT STAY HERE EVER!!! The 1 star rating is being KIND.
reviews.title: Hilton Motel

reviews.text: To book a room in a Hilton always guarantees a bad price / value relation. Everywhere, around the globe. But the Hilton in Midtown sets new standards in bad experiences. So this is my first review ever. Our corporate travel agent booked a single room for USD 499,- per night. The room was run down, dirty carpet, cheap interior, noise A/C, 19 USD for WIFI, checkout lasted 40min, nearly missed my plane. Bad bad bad. Would be a one star rated hotel in Europe. Never book this hotel, go to a hostel. It is probably a better choice and saves you and your company a lot of money.
reviews.title: A very bad experience - stay away

reviews.text: This is a classic in New York, so, it might not be "love at first" sight for many that want to stay at a place with an "ultra-modern" look.
reviews.title: A classic venue at New York ,but still a very good place to stay
Don't bother.
reviews.text: But do not be fooled by the looks, as they are always deceiving.

reviews.title: Street noise is a big problem; stealthy 50% early checkout penalty
reviews.text: Summary: This hotel has a huge problem with street noise that makes it a no go for light sleepers.

This hotel has a HUGE problem with the seals on their window frames leading to street noise entering the room. I was on the 34th floor and heard lots of noise and I was in the middle of the block with the least traffic! I feel sorry for those on floors lower than that who are close to the 53rd or 54th streets where all the traffic is... I have stayed on the 16th floor of other NYC hotels on busy streets and never heard street noise...
reviews.title: Strange experience!

reviews.text: Another thing they do to force you to sign an agreement when you check in that you will pay a 50% penalty if you leave early. I was never informed of this penalty when I booked my trip and wanted to have a flex day at the end. It seems like they must receive a lot of complaints about this because when you go to do the automated phone check out, the testy voice on the recording reminds you sternly once again that you will be penalized if you check out early. Very few hotels charge this penalty and certainly not other Hiltons. Tacky.
reviews.title: Surprised and impressed

reviews.text: Finally, on the photos on this web site you see beautiful views of Central park. Keep in mind that you will only see that view if: a) you are on floor 41-44 (executive floors) b) your view is one of the few not blocked by ajacent buildings c) and you are on the Central park side of the hotel.
reviews.title: Wlecome To New York

reviews.text: All and all, a huge impersonal hotel that is showing its age... and the street noise is a deal killer.
reviews.title: Hilton Addicted

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel about 4 times and never had any problems. The Hotel is located a block away from 5th Avenue and a block away from Times Square. The rooms are clean and a nice size. You won't be disapointed with this hotel.
reviews.title: Stayed multiple time and never had any problems
Can't fault it!
reviews.text: I have been to NYC 5 times and each of the hotels I have stayed in before have been absolutely awful - but I was led to expect this of New York hotels. This time I asked my travel agents advice and she recommended this one without any reservations as she had stayed there before herself.

reviews.title: Fabulous experience.
reviews.text: The Hilton New York is nothing like the previous NY hotels I have visited.
The location is fantastic, the staff welcoming and courteous and the hotel lobby and room were to the highest of standards.
reviews.title: Great Location, Real Convenient

reviews.text: The entry to the hotel is busy like a stock exchange. However, the rooms above are something to look for your stay in the hustle bustle of New York. The room service, and the quality of food served in the hotel are fantastic
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to Stay in New York

reviews.text: I was on 34th floor and with all the windows shut but I could still hear car noises. The noise from air conditioning was also loud and even when I turned it off, there was some other unknown noise. Besides, the shower current was not strong enough and at night the water was not hot enough even though I turned it to the hotest. Probably there was some 'competition' for hot water at night when everyone was taking a shower. Nice and clean room though and at convenient location. I like the fact that a supermarket is just across the road.
reviews.title: Noisier than I expected

reviews.text: Stayed here for a work trip. We were able to negotiate a good group rate. Great location close to anything you need. Would recommend for any business trip but is nice enough and good value enough even for someone looking to stay here on holiday.
reviews.title: Corporate comfort in central location

reviews.text: spent 2 days at hotel for national conference.taxi ride from penn station to hotel cost was $7+tip. checkin around1:30 and was lucky to get room early. it's all a matter of timing to see if housekeeping has just finished up a room through their computer system. at first try, room wasn't available. but desk clerk waited a little and tried again. bingo! got one on 26th floor. king bed room was nice and large for NY hotel. wallpaper and bathroom seems a little dated compared to modernist, minimalist newer hotels. bathroom is a little small with toilet and sink efficiently side-by-side. but still nice quality and appointments with massaging soap and other toiletries for hilton. bed was comfy and clean. elevators were fast in transporting people to floors, even with large crowds. food and meals at conference were excellent. never left hotel given sessions and receptions. but hotel's central location to the "rock", 5th ave shops, short walk to times square and central park makes it perfect place to visit ny sights. only complaint was having to pay for wifi in room though standard for ny hotels.
reviews.title: ny conference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The New York Hilton on 53 Street and Avenue of the Americas is convenient to theaters and restaurants. As Hilton Honors Club members, my husband and I take advantage of staying in New York City for the shows a couple of times a year even though we live not far away. Restaurants in the hotel provide complimentary breakfast fare.
reviews.title: Great Location for Midtown NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me preface this review with telling you New York is like my second home. I live three hours away, but travel here one or twice a month, even more so at times, to enjoy the city - and have for years and years. I think what everyone looking for a review needs to be certain they realize is the NYC is a big place - lots of choices..if you choose a "brand name" large scale hotel (such as this Hilton) in midtown Manhattan this realistically is what you'll get:
reviews.title: Hilton New York - Being realistic

reviews.text: (1) Accessible location - Times Square, 5th Ave shopping, Rockefeller Center, multiple subway stations (53rd - C, E and B, Q, N, R) within a block (1, 3, 9) lines a block further. Theatre District and Central Park within a few blocks. Starbucks on every block and shopping on Madison Ave within a few more. Radio City across the street.
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.text: (2) Clean, updated rooms of decent size for NYC - decent beds, dressers and good size closet space and a locked mini-bar. Bathrooms are a bit small, but clean, marble counters, good shower heads and pressure, very adequate and updated. Large mirrors in bath and full length mirrors on the closet doors. Towels are fluffy. Rooms range from standard fair to suites - so you have options. Although truth be said (from this Hilton honors member) the only time a suite is worth the money is for a long stay or if using for business purposes and the "executive floors" are never really worth the extra. Midtown location and demand at this convention type hotel make it fairly expensive - but remember it's NYC - it's the demand and the location.
reviews.title: A good place to stay

reviews.text: (3) There are several hotel bars and several restaurants - all convenient - but remember it's NYC....meaning average (if that) food, very expensive for quality and drinks are expensive. Even an import beer is $9.00 - but again....follow the mantra <<smile>> it's NYC! If you are going to spend $$ this city has a place for every palatte....street food...local places... (even hit the Astro one block north for a variety of simple/local food - reasonable, fast for breakfast and lunches). Get out of the hotel to eat - hotel restauants are last choice - especially in this city of endless choices in thre area and much more so beyond.
reviews.title: Bad Idea

reviews.text: (4) This Hilton is smack in midtown and hosts convention/meeting spaces - it's close to 2000 rooms - so be realistic, it's lobby will be spit-shined marble polished but as big and wide as an airport terminal; and it will have (at times) just as many people...which means long lines for everything...charging for luggage storage ($3.50 per) and lots and lots of service employees that are not trained to act as ambassadors to the city. Again...it's NYC - I have stayed here numerous times, you do get some helpful people and smiling staff and then you just get those that go about their jobs with no extra or any effort to the public.
reviews.title: Nice Stat at the Hilton New York
Generall good
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton for the St. Patricks weekend.

Hotel itself is large, but fairly standard. We had a 14th floor room which was small but well kept (flat screen TV) and sufficient for our needs. Better than I expected for the price ($200). Only thing which we didn't have which would have been useful was a hair dryer in room. The guest information intimated that there was one but we never found it.
reviews.title: Decent stay in one-bedroom suite

reviews.text: Didn't eat or drink in the hotel as we knew it would be pricey. Location is excellent for "tourist traps" and it's close to subway for anywhere.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the staff

reviews.text: Would definitely recommend it at the price I paid, though I believe (reading the posts) that some get it even cheaper. Have had much worse rooms in NY for more cash.
reviews.title: Great location - cleanliness an issue

reviews.text: I stayed with my wife and two young children in a one bedroom suite (room 4325) at Hilton New York for four nights from March 11 to 15, 2006. The rate we paid was US$479 per night before taxes.
reviews.title: needs room renovations

reviews.text: I have stayed in a dozen hotels across New York. I am a Hilton Diamond and generally get a decent experience from them because of my Hilton level. On my first stay at this hotel, staff went out of its way to aggravate me.
reviews.title: Skip this Hotel

reviews.text: 1. the cost. Room was $500/night and mediocre at best.
reviews.title: Room was not ready, No AC, reeked of smoke, no help from Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. the desk in the room was abysmal. Please, a little renovation goes a long way.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.text: 3. Packages. My office sent a FedEx to me. Aside from the fact no one would deliver it, I had to find the "Package Delivery Center" and then get charged $4 for picking up my own package. I think this is where I lost it. I have never had a hotel anywhere charge me for picking up my own package delivered to their hotel. Bad form, Hilton, bad form.
reviews.title: Perfect CHoice

reviews.text: 4. Business center is a joke. I had a 9 page document, no color, that I needed to print. For the first time ever, I was told the cost was $2/page to print a document. Unbelievable.
reviews.title: Book the two bedroom suite!

reviews.text: The 34th floor was great as you could catch one of two groups of elevators and never have to wait. The ice-machine was full and right by the service area so if you needed more soap/towels, you could have picked them up yourself too.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Perfect location, walked all over midtown, Central Park, quick response to any problem or question, the BEST breakfast (opt for rate which includes breakfast!), good restaurant, smallish rooms are typical of NYC but very clean and nice bath with large shower! Brought our granddaughter to NYC for her birthday and the trip was PERFECT! It even snowed on cue for her carriage ride through the park after birthday tea at the Plaza!
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Breakfast

reviews.text: wonderful location! rockefeller centre and radio city music hall just outside. empire state building and chrysler tower nearby, times square and central park walkable, just can't beat it. very very small rooms but definitely comfortable and well equipped. the lobby and common areas look jaded and need some uplift. but who cares. you stay here for the location and just that!!
reviews.title: wow what location!!

reviews.text: We stayed here for my daughters 14th birthday. This is our second time staying at this hotel. The location can not be beat. We were given a room on the 6th floor with a view of 55th street and 6th ave. Most of my stays in NYC the view is of a brick wall or another building so it was nice to be able to see some activity without paying more for it. The room was clean but very dark. Non functioning bath room exhaust fan so after two showers the room was full of steam. The plumbing is very loud for some reason. The sound of rushing water late into the night was bothersome but closing the bathroom door seemed to quiet it enough to sleep. The hotel staff that I had contact with were very friendly. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.text: Stayed here a week ago for 5 nights, booked through Trailfinders, the location is excellent on 6th Avenue and only 4 blocks from Central Park, 10 blocks from Times Square(1/2 mile).
reviews.title: Great location but average service.

reviews.text: Check in was quick but unfortunately given the wrong room with only 1 bed, this was corrected to a room on 23rd floor at the far end of floor. Room was surprisingly big and clean, bathroom was bijou, no noise from the streets, but could hear chat from neighbouring rooms.
reviews.title: Great location in NY, lovely rooms, service a little iffy

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here from March 10 to 12. We have no complaints about the hotel. We used the kiosks near the front desk to check ourselves in, and the phone in our room to check ourselves out. We had a queen room on the 10th floor near the elevator and although we could hear the elevators going up and down, it was not loud enough to keep us up at night. We couldn’t hear any street noise.
reviews.title: Great for the money

reviews.text: This is my 2nd visit to the Hilton New York, and it may be my last. The location is fantastic - walking distance to Central Park & Columbus Circle, as well as walking distance to anywhere in Midtown - Macy's, Rockefeller, Times Square, etc. Great, great location. The beds are comfortable, but I found the sheets to be hard & crunchy - and very loud each time you moved. For the price you pay, I think the sheets could be of higher quality, as well as the service could use a lot of help. I'm a Hilton Diamond Member, and used the Diamond member check-in, and still received lackluster service. The people at the desk were bordering on rude, and just completely didn't care about me or anyone checking in before or after us. I don't expect to be fawned over, but a friendly greeting and kind attitude would be appreciated. The hotel was extremely busy & full this weekend. Our room was not ready before 3pm, and the luggage room was full at check-in, so we had to leave our luggage in a sectioned off area in the lobby - not the safest feeling, but it did have someone watching over it, luckily. Our room was also not completely clean - we found leftover food & newspapers in the cabinet when we got up to our room - that's just gross, and again, at $400+ per night, seriously, attention to detail needs to be a top priority. I called customer service about the outlets in the room not working, and never received a response during my stay. The room itself is nice enough, there are plenty of elevators, and it's mostly quiet. I was on the 15th floor and you can still hear some street noise, but not nearly as loud as many other NYC hotels. I'd recommend this hotel on location, but not on service or quality of the rooms.
reviews.title: Great location, NOT great service

reviews.text: We stayed here a few months ago. The location is perfect for Radio City, Central Park and Times Square. The check in went smoothly and the staff were friendly. Our room was on an upper floor and had a great view looking toward Central Park ( you could see it in the distance).
reviews.title: Great location...room needed cleaning.

reviews.text: When we first went into the room everything looked fine. We later noticed that there was dirt and dust stuck to the wall all around the top by the ceiling and right over the bed. It was nasty.
reviews.title: A huge thank you after being displaced by Hurricane Sandy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is long overdue, but we are finally getting back on track at home after Hurricane Sandy devistated our Long Island community. Our family sought shelter for six days at the Hilton New York when we were forced to leave our home after Hurricane Sandy left us without power, heat and water. I can't express how thankful i am to the staff who where extremely helpful and kind to us. Especially those who work in the Executive Lounge, Amy, Mercedes, Debra, Daniel, Guillermo, Jose and David I can't thank you enough! What a wonderful group of people. It's not easy keeping two small children busy all day being far from home while your husband is at work, but staying here during a not so easy time for us made it better. Thank you all again and i look forward to coming to stay again in the future.
reviews.title: Very good, but definitely not great

reviews.text: Warm regards,
reviews.title: Recent Stay

reviews.text: Although the location was good, the hotel itself fell short in several ways. I was initially given a room that had styrofoam packing bits all over the floor. No apologies, just had to go down and get another key for a similar room on a lower floor. The second room was reasonably sized, clean, with an excellent bed and flat screen TV, somewhat cramped bathroom with loose shower door handle, and a rug and a few towels that were beginning to look worn. Service was good, but not special. The hotel was always bustling, with elevators slow and crowded. For the price, I would have expected more, even in Manhattan.
reviews.title: less than 4 star quality

reviews.text: We went with our children (9yo and 7yo) for a holiday weekend. It was really cold, so walking outside was tough. It's a great location. Saw the Rockettes...great location for that.
reviews.title: good buffet bfast

reviews.text: We stayed at the upper floor, so we had complimentary bfast...which was great w/the kids.
reviews.title: Completely unhelpful and rude

likes.liked: — I was attending a conference at the hotel so it was convenient to stay in the same hotel.
likes.disliked: — Concierge desk, small noisy room, not clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was suffering from a bad cold at my last stay at the Hilton New York. I ordered food from a delivery service. I got a call from the concierge desk letting me know that the food was at the concierge desk for me to pick up. I asked if it could be delivered to my room and I was told no. In the time it took me to get out of bed and get fully dressed to go downstairs, I received a second call from the concierge desk (different person) basically giving me flack for making the driver wait for me and that the driver was about to leave with my order. I rushed down thinking the driver needed my signature or something. When I got there he just handed me the food and left. Besides not helping the situation, the first call from the concierge desk didn't tell me the driver was waiting and the second call I received was rude.
reviews.title: Great Location - Great Price!

reviews.text: I was very disappointed with the service I received. I pay extra to stay at a four star hotel for the service. The room wasn't even that great. It was small, one of the phones didn't work, there was still garbage from the previous patron when I checked in the room and it was incredibly noisy at night (not from outside noises - must have been some kind of service elevator). I will never stay here again and I'm a Hilton Gold member.
reviews.title: So - So

likes.disliked: — the restaurants were not easily accessable

reviews.text: This is supposed to be a convention hotel, but it is ill-equipped to handle a full house. We checked in on a weekday afternoon for one night. Even with gold status, no upgrade was available and the room we were assigned was small and unrenovated. The furniture was mismatched and shabby and the bathroom was miniscule. (The bed, linens, and pillows were up-to-date, however). The halls were strewn with litter, bags of used linens, and unrecovered room service trays. We were given two breakfast coupons with options for service in the Marketplace restaurant, three-item carryout for the restaurant, or carryout from Starbucks. At 9:00 the next morning, the line for the restaurant was at least 15 people deep and it probably would have taken 30 minutes to be seated. There was only one employee at the restaurant's carryout station and there were at least six people in line. It took approximately 20 minutes to be served. Each time a guest requested an item, the employee had to either visit the buffet or enter the kitchen to retrieve it. This was a model of inefficiency. The line at Starbucks was also about six-deep. As a result of these delays, we almost missed our train from Penn Station. At nearly $500 for the night (with tax), this was a poor value to say the least. The hotel obviously has no regard for service or the needs of its customers and this will be our last visit.
reviews.title: Can't Handle the Crowds

reviews.text: In the weeks before Christmas, New York hotels get busy and with low availabilty, I had to get a room at this hotel for ridiculously high rates, something this hotel certainly does not deserve.
reviews.title: Horrible hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only good things about this hotel are the great location (close to Central Park, Rockefeller Centre and MOMA) and the room size which, for New York, is large.
reviews.title: Hotel room disgusting

reviews.text: The hotel is horrible in every other way. Poor attitude and low level service all across - whether it is front-office, room service or the restaurant. Lack of room amenities (not even bedroom slippers; no coffee-maker; wifi for a fee) - and one tea served to your room will cost you $17. Breakfast will cost $45. Expensive for this level of hotel - even The Peninsula is cheaper.
reviews.title: Expensive Motel 6

reviews.text: On most occassions, room service forgot some ingredient; once it was the tea bags itself! The carpet in the room had several stains, the laundry service (outsourced) was not upto the mark. You cannot reach the elevator bank without being confronted by Hilton time share agents luring you to a 'presentation'.
reviews.title: Great location.............noisy room

reviews.text: I was in New York for a family wedding and decided to make a weekend of it. As I shopped around, I realized quickly that even weekend nights in a Manhattan hotel are quite expensive. Nevertheless, I chose the Hilton on 6th Avenue for its location more than anything else. It proved to be a good move after taking the train to New York from Newark and then the subway to the Rockefeller Center station. That put me at 7th Ave. & 53rd Street, which was only a cross-town block to the Hilton.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good Location

reviews.text: Although I arrived before 3 p.m., the staff promptly checked me in and gave me a key to my room. The room was well appointed and the bed was comfortable. I found most of the staff to be friendly and willing to answer questions, although the concierge treated me as if I were somewhat of a rube. I did finally get a restaurant recommendation from her, but that was the only time I felt less than welcome. It was an easy walk to Times Square, where I was able to pick up a half price ticket to a Broadway show the next day.
reviews.title: dream come true

reviews.text: I would advise travelers to expect a fairly long wait at the taxi queue in front of the Hilton after 6 p.m. It took more than 30 minutes to get a taxi, as most just drove right by. I checked out of the Hilton early on a Sunday morning and it was as easy as making a phone call from my room. It was a good trip and I would use this Hilton again.
reviews.title: A busy place, Hustle Bustle

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the New York Hilton to celebrate my sister's 50th birthday. I had made a request to be upgraded if possible. We were surprised to find that we had been upgraded to a suite and given access to the executive floor. I am from Miami and have stayed at this property many times over the past 12 years because of the service and convenient location. I want to recognize the exceptional attention given to us by Claudia, executive level manager, who was able to honor our request and Madeline, executive level hostess, who always makes us feel as if we were returning home.
reviews.title: use as last option

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A got a theatre package for a Christmas getaway. It was a hectic journey from Newark airport into Manhatten that day. When we arrivied at the Hilton before 3:00pm, even as I telephoned directly the day before, the front check in desk could Not find our theatre tickets to Wicked, part of the package. We were booked intos the Hilton for five nights. It was stressful using careful confrontation and then agueing with the front desk! So I called the manager, a petite asian woman, who simply when behind the front desk and came out with out tickets all ready for us in an envelope with my name on it.! ( btw..the production was that very night best seats) My lady companion was crying, upset and tired.We travelled from afar. They offered us an upgrade to a higher floor, basically the same room we requested, and inclued one buffet breakfast in the hotel diner. They were late checking us in, the place was very hectic. I opted for breakfast Each morning, which was agreed and turned over with a scowl. The rest of the trip was fine. The room was nice, two comfortable beds, a sheer curtain window, no view, but also no street noise. There was bathroom and private dressing area, only five hangers, and the room was clean and modern. A nice, very nice, flat screen tv and only a little scatch pad for stationery to make a note on. No letter and envelope type thing which I always would appreciate. The breakfast buffet was Very early, serve yourself and Still leave a nice tip for the coffee server. There was a pushy Jewellery store, high pressure sales staff, the shop in the lobby, beside the conceige. They would not leave us alone, even waving us in, when we were spotted just walking past. Annoying. It was again Holiday Christmas Season, there was a threatening trasit strike so people were on edge. Fifth Ave was blocked off in places to accomadate so many window shoppers, we Enjoyed Carnegie Hall,Handle's Massiah, and watched the skaters at the Rock, so the Location of the Hilton was good. A drafty windy street however,but outside The Hilton, plenty of taxis. Letterman Show was walking distance that was fun as well. I would prefer a quieter Hotel and location in NYC. This is really Times Square Area,so expect a lot of masses and crowds. The Hilton kept everything very secure, we showed ID at the door just to be in the Lobby, A friend who came to see us. who lives in NYC, had to show his ID to even meet us there. I again do not know what I would have done, if I would have simply accepted the continueous brush off, initially that "We do not have your theatre tickets", they were right were they were suppose to be. Clearly a non caring frustrated employee. This place is just another concrete high rise, the lobby nothing really special, a couple couches, a non spectular Holiday tree, and a maze off hallway to find the elevators. We got a nice package deal in advance,so in that way it was very much worth it. I enjoyed the room and the fact that yes, we stayed at the Hilton!
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel all around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During a December visit to New York we spent one night here.
reviews.title: One to forget

reviews.text: Thank goodness it was just one night.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: We were aware that it was a large hotel but have stayed in larger hotels in the Far East and still been made to feel a human being.
reviews.title: Get a renovated room

reviews.text: It is totally souless and the entrance like being in an airport check in hall. The doormen take absolutely no notice of arriving guests.
reviews.title: Midtown Convenience

likes.disliked: — Overpriced mini-bar, internet access, and hotel restaurants/food. Nickle and dime...

reviews.text: The check in staff seem to be robots having no interest in guests and simply going through the motions. The attitude seems to be - If the hotel creates a problem it is your problem do not tell us.
reviews.title: Stressful Hilton Weekend

likes.liked: — Room was nice and contemporary - flat screen, new bathroom and nice decor
likes.disliked: — VERY rude front desk employees with no customer service etiquette abilities

reviews.text: I fought to try and get something closer to Times Square but they were sold out. It turned out to be a great decision as the location is perfect - a 10 minute walk to Times Square yet avoids all the crowds and noise associated with staying in that area. Steps to Central Park and 5th Ave shopping. Deluxe rooms are great. Very clean and modern. This is a large hotel so if you want boutique this is not for you. Avoid breakfast here - better options all around the neighborhood. Full-service grocery store across the street. Also charge excessive rates for wi-fi use. Concierge desk was outstanding. They made great recommendations for dinner (and reservations too), I needed a specialty store for puzzles and they came up with a name. They were very helpful. Made for a perfect weekend. Thanks Hilton New York!
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: Having to narrow down all the hotels in New York City for one that wasn't too expensive or far from attractions or not child friendly was quite a chore. I read the reviews on many of the hotels and finally decided on the Hilton. The one thing that stood out was the staff. They were extremely friendly and accommodating (we had no shampoo in our room and a light was out---all rectified within a quick time). I highly recommend the executive level. My kids loved the breakfast in the morning. The evening was a bit more crowded but my boys, again, loved the cheese and crackers. And the cookies in between were a hit. My husband and I loved the all day access to coffee. Also our floor was very quiet. The only problem we encountered was the weather (warm one day, freezing the next) and the thermostat in our room left us warmer than usual. It finally adjusted our last day. We opened a window which let in all the city sounds. At times, exciting, but sirens blaring at 3 am kept me awake (my boys slept through it all!!). Really something out of everyone's hands, I thought. Didn't let it ruin the trip. Would highly recommend the Gazillion bubble show too. All in all a really nice place to stay...my country bumpkins probably won't be back for awhile, but it was overall a nice experience.
reviews.title: What great staff!

reviews.text: It's worth it. Just do it.
reviews.title: Awesome location, Exquisite experience

reviews.text: Easy access to Central Park, museums, shopping, train lines.... and really, you're just in the middle of it all from here - so pay the extra $25 and book a room.
reviews.title: Great Room Great Location Great Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and well taken care of... you definitely get the feel of that New York hustle and bustle here. Worth every penny.
reviews.title: Great location - but not Hilton standard

aka: Hilton New York Hotel New York City
description: A sophisticated international hotel designed for both the business and leisure traveler, the New York Hilton Midtown is located in the midst of New York City’s business headquarters and media centers, conveniently near Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, and the Museum of Modern Art, just one block from Fifth Avenue shopping, and a short stroll to Times Square, Broadway theatres, Central Park, and many more cultural attractions for which New York is famous. Equipped with modern conveniences to meet all your business and travel needs, the hotel features extensive facilities.
